description: We compare MI-SVM (heuristic), SMM, and MI-SMM (heuristic) based on a principled approach of using all combinations of features for MI-SVM.  The 4 combinations use the rbf kernel and choices of univariate features (skew, kurtosis, 25th percentile, 75th percentile), multivariate features (2-way correlations), neither, or both.  Simulations were run in condor.
data parameters:
See sim/dataset-parameters.R for details.  Key difference is in the distributions, which are MVT for positive instances and MVN for negative instances.  The distributions have the same mean and covariance. 

nbag_test <- 500
methods run:
mildsvm qp-heuristic
mildsvm mip
smm
misvm (4 combinations of features, method = "heuristic")

mildsvm mip

description: Same as 1.0.0, except we add methods to compare MI-SVM with the QP-heuristic method, which uses a more precise formulation of the original Andrews et al. (2003) MI-SVM paper.

We compare MI-SVM (heuristic), SMM, and MI-SMM (qp-heuristic) based on a principled approach of using all combinations of features for MI-SVM.  The 4 combinations use the rbf kernel and choices of univariate features (skew, kurtosis, 25th percentile, 75th percentile), multivariate features (2-way correlations), neither, or both.  Simulations were run in condor.
data parameters: We use the motivating data set of collagen fiber features as the dataset
methods run:
mildsvm qp-heuristic
mildsvm mip
smm
misvm (4 combinations of features, method = "qp-heuristic")
